meanings.definition: A person who deceives or tricks others.
meanings.sent1: The hoodwinker pretended to be a prince to fool the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The detective uncovered the hoodwinker's elaborate scheme.
meanings.sent3: The hoodwinker's disguise was so convincing that even the wise owl was fooled.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the hoodwinker's silver tongue, for his words are as sharp as a dagger.
meanings.sent5: The hoodwinker's mask of innocence hid a heart full of deceit.

meanings.sent1: She tried to hoodwinker her brother into believing the moon was made of cheese.
meanings.sent2: The con artist managed to hoodwinker the old man out of his life savings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon attempted to hoodwinker the farmer by stealing his corn.
meanings.sent4: His charming smile could hoodwinker anyone into doing his bidding.
meanings.sent5: The magician's illusions were so convincing that they could hoodwinker even the most skeptical audience member.
